title: Nursing home residents prove age is no barrier as they dance in the viral 'Git Up' challenge
text:
A group of elderly nursing home residents have taken part in a viral dancing challenge.

A video posted to Facebook on Friday shows residents from Murray Haven Homes in Barham, in south-west New South Wales, busting out moves to Blanco Brown's hit song 'Git Up'.

The 'challenge'- step-by-step choreography inspired by the song's lyrics and video - has become a worldwide internet sensation as groups gather to dance and film their performances.

A video (pictured) posted to Facebook on Friday shows residents from Murray Haven Homes in Barham, in south-west NSW, busting out moves to Blanco Brown's hit song 'Git Up'

The footage shows three women with walkers taking the lead while those with wheel chairs partake in the back.

Residence Manager Gary Kairn told 7News both staff and residents loved taking part in the challenge.

'We saw it was out there and one of our nurses decided that it would be a fantastic activity to involve the residents and staff,' Kairn said.

The group trained for three weeks to perfect the dance.

'It was fantastic,' Mr Kairn said.

Staffers coordinated the dance and residents were quick to get involved.

Barham Public School students, who regularly visit the home, also took part in the dance.

The 'Git Up' video has racked up over 41 million views on YouTube since it was uploaded in June.
description: A video posted to Facebook on Friday shows residents from Murray Haven Homes in Barham, in south-west NSW, busting out moves to Blanco Brown's hit song 'Git Up'.
authors: Tita Smith For Daily Mail Australia
